intro: Myrcianthes leucoxyla, commonly known as the white-wooded myrcia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of the understory in rainforests. Myrcianthes leucoxyla is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local communities.
